Resume

As a product manager and social entrepreneur, I am constantly seeking ways to leverage innovative ideas and technology to solve world problems. I seek adventures which help me to better understand the world's diverse cultures. My travels have enabled me to support journalism education initiatives in Central Asia, women's empowerment projects in Egypt, and economic development ventures in the vibrant tech sector of Austin Texas.

I currently live in Berlin, Germany, where I work with the eBay Classifides Group.

I like to write non-fiction books and play drums.

LinkedIn PDF Resume

International economic and community development professional with 10+ years of consulting experience in both the private business space and the NGO / humanitarian aid relief sectors on five continents. I am trusted with a top secret security clearance and have a proven commitment to fostering partnerships which bring innovative thought and technology to the forefront of solving problems at community and global scales.

Work Experience

Product Manager

trivago, Düsseldorf Germany | 2017 – present

  • Find, define and validate opportunities and user problems worth solving on trivago
  • Test features in a methodological, hypothesis-driven way using pre-defined KPIs
  • Work backward by authoring initiative docs which include press releases and shipment plans
  • Present my knowledge and A/B test results learnings with peers and executive leadership
  • Work collaboratively and cross-functionally across domains with diverse stakeholders
  • Guide agile product management with scrum rituals and artifacts

Product Marketing Manager for North America

trivago, Düsseldorf Germany | 2016 – 2017

  • Spokesperson for trivago business communications in the USA market
  • Represent trivago at trade fairs, workshops, and other public functions such as webinars
  • Develop relationships with top media, associations, and other influencers
  • Established trivago B2B Twitter account in the US market; +200% month-over-month follower growth
  • Author of trade articles on trivago's B2B blog: hotelmanager-blog.com

Operations Manager

Mutual Mobile, Austin, TX USA | 2013 – 2015

  • Reduced operational expenses 20% while simultaneously expanding employee benefits
  • Constructed a facility in Hyderabad, India, for a workforce of 100 people on-time and on-budget
  • Orchestrated 40,000’sq renovation of the corporate headquarters
  • Trained and managed 8 employees who were responsible for essential central services promoting corporate culture, event management, space management, and client relations

Community and Economic Developer

United States Peace Corps, Bishkek Kyrgyzstan | 2011 – 2013

  • Established strategic vision to leverage the power of mobile for connecting rural journalists with each other and the world via KyrgyzMedia.com; secured $500k of funding over 3-years from the United Nations; operates in 20+ communities; receives 15,000 unique web visitors annually.
  • Authored and delivered bi-monthly capacity-building trainings to 20+ media organizations
  • Designed measuring and evaluation plans per United Nations and USAID requirements

Executive Director

Kloop Media Foundation, Austin, TX USA | 2013 – 2015

  • Raised awareness and funding for journalisim education initiatives in Central Asia

Assistant Director of Student Affairs

Loyola University, New Orleans, LA USA | 2009 – 2010

  • Crafted and taught event management curriculum to student organizations and student leaders

Manager of Special Events

Paul Cummings World Wide Enterprises, Chattanooga, TN USA | 2008 – 2009

  • Produced corporate functions, concerts, retreats and workshops, including a nationally–touring lecture and training series in partnership with international recording artist Beth Hart

Concert Promoter

Green Machine Concerts, Memphis, TN USA | 2007 – 2008

  • Negotiated and coordinated efforts between international talent agencies, artists, universities, venues, and other corporate clients to produce world-class concerts, festivals and tours

Event Manager

Louisiana State University Athletics, Baton Rouge, LA | 2006 –

  • Prepared sports venues for events by constructing and striking specific setups for basketball, volleyball, gymnastics, concerts and graduation events.

Emergency Response Planner

American Red Cross, Baton Rouge, LA USA | 2005 – 2007

  • Authored and coordinated response plans between the Red Cross and other local, state and federal emergency preparedness agencies.

Assistant Director of Student Affairs

Loyola University, New Orleans, LA USA | 2009 – 2010

  • Crafted and taught event management curriculum to student organizations and student leaders

WHAT OTHERS SAY

Here are a few recommendations I have received. Contact me for more information.

Mr. Moore shows his motivation and professionalism as a trainer and innovator of community information services. Kyrgyzmedia.com became a well-recognized cooperation platform for traditional media outlets including the Public Service Corporation in Kyrgyzstan. [He] has shown broad abilities in the strengthening of media pluralism, building institutional capacities of media NGOs and outlets.

Sergey Karpov

Communication and Information Programme Specialist

DW Akademie

Under conditions which many would consider unbearable, Judson not only found a way to try something new, but he was the driving force behind making it flourish and securing funding from the United Nations, which promises the project's success for years to come.

Bettina Ruigies

Department Head, Asia & Europe Division

DW Akademie

Judson took active part in pioneering new direction in our journalism activities. Judson started a project of community multimedia centers, which by now received more than $300,000 in funding from UNESCO, EC and UNDEF. Judson understands the country better than many local people. He is also able to lead and report on most complex project according to stringent requirements of international donors.

Rinat Tuhvatshin

Development Manager

Kloop Media

Judson left a large legacy in Kyrgyzstan. I had a deep respect for Judson's passion and commitment to free speech and social justice in the Kyrgyz Republic. He adapted well to the culture of Kyrgyzstan, learned the languages, and developed many local friends. His accomplishments with local media were substantial and lasting.

Seth Fearey

Country Director, Kyrgyz Republic

United States Peace Corps

At Mutual Mobile, Judson managed several crucial projects for the executive team, using creative strategies to ensure success. When given high-level concepts, he was quickly able to distill them into tactical and actionable items, which provided tremendous value to our company.

Ed Ireson

Director, People Operations

Mutual Mobile

Judson was able to lead complex projects with many moving parts, variables and targets. His pursuit of excellence allowed him to execute projects flawlessly and lead others to accomplish their goals and tasks. He has a way to rally people, get them on side and aligned with goals.

Christine Rybas

Marketing Manger

Paul Cummings Enterprises
